getChildFields

public Iterator<PSField> getChildFields(int childMapperId)
Convenience method that gets the PSField objects associated with the specified complex child. Only those items that have a mapping are returned.

This list also includes all fields that display with the child but whose fields are not directly in the associated fieldset, such as simple children and SDMP (single data, multi-property) fieldsets.

Parameters:
childMapperId - The id of the mapper of the complex child of interest.
Returns:
An iterator over 1 or more PSFields, in document (display) order. If no mapper matching the supplied id is found, null is returned.

getMappedParentFields

public List<PSField> getMappedParentFields()
Convenience method that gets the PSField objects associated with the main item. Only those items that have a mapping. It does NOT include the field that does not have UI mapping. Use getParentFields() to get ALL fields. This method can be used remotely.

This list also includes all fields that display with the parent but whose display mappings are not directly in the parent's fieldset, such as simple children and SDMP (single data, multi-property) fieldsets.

Returns:
1 or more PSField objects, in document order.

getSingleDimensionParentTextFieldNames

public List<String> getSingleDimensionParentTextFieldNames()
This method returns all user visible fields present in the parent editor that store data as a single value (not as arrays or tables.) and storage type as text.

Returns:
list of field names, never null.

getContentEditorMapper

public com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSContentEditorMapper getContentEditorMapper()
Convenient method to get the content editor mapper.

Returns:
Content editor mapper returned by PSContentEditorPipe#getMapper

getParentFields

public Iterator<PSField> getParentFields()
Convenience method that gets the PSField objects associated with the main item. Only those items that have a mapping or are system fields stored in the db are returned.

This list also includes all fields that display with the parent but whose display mappings are not directly in the parent's fieldset, such as simple children and SDMP (single data, multi-property) fieldsets.

This cannot be used remotely.

Returns:
An iterator over 1 or more PSFields, in document (display) order.

getFieldByName

public PSField getFieldByName(String fieldName)
Convenience method that calls getFieldByName(fieldName) on the parent field set of the associated content editor.

getPageId

public int getPageId(String fieldName)
Get the page id for the supplied fieldname. Page ids are used in conjuntion with the edit and preview commands to identify the correct editor page. Parent page (main editor) has a page id of 0. Each complex child found in mapping order increments this value by 2, first for its summary page, and second for its editor page. Thus for the nth complex child field found, its summary page id will be 2*n-1, and its editor page id will be 2*n.

Parameters:
fieldName - The name of the field, may not be null or empty.
Returns:
If the field is found in the top level mapper, the parent page id is returned. If the field identifies a complex child, the summary page id for that child is returned. If the field is contained within a complex child, then the editor page id for that child is returned. If no matching field is found, -1 is returned.

isUserSearcheable

public boolean isUserSearcheable()
Determine if the content type represented by this definition is enabled for indexing and thus may be searched.

Returns:
true if it may be searched, false otherwise.

isUserSearcheable

public boolean isUserSearcheable(int childId)
Determine if the specified child is enabled for indexing and thus may be be searched. Note that if isUserSearcheable() returns false, this method always returns false.

Parameters:
childId - The child's mapper id.
Returns:
true if the child is searchable, false if it is not, or if this content type is not searchable, or if the fieldset for the specified child id cannot be located.

Parameters:

Specified by:
tuneClone in interface com.percussion.services.data.IPSCloneTuner

getComplexChildren

public List<com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSFieldSet> getComplexChildren()
Walks all entries in the main mapper and each one that is for a complex child, the associated fieldset is collected. A complex child is a field set with a type of PSFieldSet.TYPE_COMPLEX_CHILD. All found sets are returned.

The mapper is walked to eliminate field set definitions that could be present but are not actually used.

Returns:
Never null, may be empty. Caller takes ownership of returned list. The sets are ordered in document order.

getFieldMimeType

public String getFieldMimeType(String fieldName,
                               Map<String,String> fieldValues)
Gets the mimetype associated with the field. The mimetype is determined by mimeTypeMode property of the field. If the mode is "From Selection", then the mimetype value is fetched from mimeTypeValue property of the field. If the mode is "From Extension Field" then the mimeTypeValue property provides the name of the field that will hold the extension at runtime. The extension is fetched from the supplied fieldValues map and then the corresponding mimetype for that extension is returned. If the mode is "From Mime Type Field" then mimeTypeValue property provides the name of the field that will hold the mimetype at runtime. The mime type is fetched from the supplied fieldValues map and returned. If the mode is null or empty then the mimetype is guessed based on the following algorithm. If the data type of the field is binary then the name of the extension field is guessed as "fieldName_ext". The extension is fetched from the supplied fieldValues map and then the corresponding mimetype for that extension is returned. If extension field does not exist or its value is empty then it gets the mimetype value from field with name "fieldName_type". If that is also empty then returns empty mimetype. If the datatype is clob with max data format, then the mime type is guessed as text/html. for all other data types the mime type is returned as text/plain.

Parameters:
fieldName - The name of the field for which the the mime type needs to be returned. Must not be null or empty and must be a valid field.
fieldValues - The map of field names and values. Must not be null. If empty and the mimetype mode is either from extension field or mimetype field then the returned value will be empty.
Returns:
The mime type of the field as per the method description or empty string if is not set properly or could not guess it right, but never null.

getFieldMimeType

public String getFieldMimeType(String fieldName,
                               IPSRequestContext request)
Convenient method to get the mime type similar to getFieldMimeType(String, Map) except the field value is extracted from request instead of the fieldValues map.
